intro: Osteospermum bidens, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow with a central dark purple or brown disk, blooming in spring and summer. Osteospermum bidens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
